trans-unit.source: This topic describes the use of contact geometry for touch targeting and provides best practices for targeting in Windows Runtime apps.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the use of contact geometry for touch targeting and provides best practices for targeting in Windows Runtime apps.

trans-unit.source: Targeting
trans-unit.target: Targeting

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for targeting
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for targeting

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Touch targeting in Windows uses the full contact area of each finger that is detected by a touch digitizer.
trans-unit.target: Touch targeting in Windows uses the full contact area of each finger that is detected by a touch digitizer.

trans-unit.source: The larger, more complex set of input data reported by the digitizer is used to increase precision when determining the user's intended (or most likely) target.
trans-unit.target: The larger, more complex set of input data reported by the digitizer is used to increase precision when determining the user's intended (or most likely) target.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Core
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Core

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Input

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Xaml.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Xaml.Input

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the use of contact geometry for touch targeting and provides best practices for targeting in UWP apps.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the use of contact geometry for touch targeting and provides best practices for targeting in UWP apps.

trans-unit.source: Measurements and scaling
trans-unit.target: Measurements and scaling

trans-unit.source: To remain consistent across different screen sizes and pixel densities, all target sizes are represented in physical units (millimeters).
trans-unit.target: To remain consistent across different screen sizes and pixel densities, all target sizes are represented in physical units (millimeters).

trans-unit.source: Physical units can be converted to pixels by using the following equation:
trans-unit.target: Physical units can be converted to pixels by using the following equation:

trans-unit.source: Pixels = Pixel Density × Measurement
trans-unit.target: Pixels = Pixel Density × Measurement

trans-unit.source: The following example uses this formula to calculate the pixel size of a 9 mm target on a 135 pixel per inch (PPI) display at a 1x scaling plateau:
trans-unit.target: The following example uses this formula to calculate the pixel size of a 9 mm target on a 135 pixel per inch (PPI) display at a 1x scaling plateau:

trans-unit.source: Pixels = 135 PPI × 9 mm
trans-unit.target: Pixels = 135 PPI × 9 mm

trans-unit.source: Pixels = 135 PPI × (0.03937 inches per mm × 9 mm)
trans-unit.target: Pixels = 135 PPI × (0.03937 inches per mm × 9 mm)

trans-unit.source: Pixels = 135 PPI × 0.35433 inches
trans-unit.target: Pixels = 135 PPI × 0.35433 inches

trans-unit.source: Pixels = 48 pixels
trans-unit.target: Pixels = 48 pixels

trans-unit.source: This result must be adjusted according to each scaling plateau defined by the system.
trans-unit.target: This result must be adjusted according to each scaling plateau defined by the system.

trans-unit.source: Thresholds
trans-unit.target: Thresholds

trans-unit.source: Distance and time thresholds may be used to determine the outcome of an interaction.
trans-unit.target: Distance and time thresholds may be used to determine the outcome of an interaction.

trans-unit.source: For example, when a touch-down is detected, a tap is registered if the object is dragged less than 2.7 mm from the touch-down point and the touch is lifted within 0.1 second or less of the touch-down.
trans-unit.target: For example, when a touch-down is detected, a tap is registered if the object is dragged less than 2.7 mm from the touch-down point and the touch is lifted within 0.1 second or less of the touch-down.

trans-unit.source: Moving the finger beyond this 2.7 mm threshold results in the object being dragged and either selected or moved (for more information, see [Guidelines for cross-slide](guidelines-for-cross-slide.md)).
trans-unit.target: Moving the finger beyond this 2.7 mm threshold results in the object being dragged and either selected or moved (for more information, see [Guidelines for cross-slide](guidelines-for-cross-slide.md)).

trans-unit.source: Depending on your app, holding the finger down for longer than 0.1 second may cause the system to perform a self-revealing interaction (for more information, see [Guidelines for visual feedback](guidelines-for-visualfeedback.md#selfreveal)).
trans-unit.target: Depending on your app, holding the finger down for longer than 0.1 second may cause the system to perform a self-revealing interaction (for more information, see [Guidelines for visual feedback](guidelines-for-visualfeedback.md#selfreveal)).

trans-unit.source: Target sizes
trans-unit.target: Target sizes

trans-unit.source: In general, set your touch target size to 9 mm square or greater (48x48 pixels on a 135 PPI display at a 1.0x scaling plateau).
trans-unit.target: In general, set your touch target size to 9 mm square or greater (48x48 pixels on a 135 PPI display at a 1.0x scaling plateau).

trans-unit.source: Avoid using touch targets that are less than 7 mm square.
trans-unit.target: Avoid using touch targets that are less than 7 mm square.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram shows how target size is typically a combination of a visual target, actual target size, and any padding between the actual target and other potential targets.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows how target size is typically a combination of a visual target, actual target size, and any padding between the actual target and other potential targets.

trans-unit.source: diagram showing the recommended sizes for the visual target, actual target, and padding.
trans-unit.target: diagram showing the recommended sizes for the visual target, actual target, and padding.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the minimum and recommended sizes for the components of a touch target.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the minimum and recommended sizes for the components of a touch target.

trans-unit.source: Target component
trans-unit.target: Target component

trans-unit.source: Minimum size
trans-unit.target: Minimum size

trans-unit.source: Recommended size
trans-unit.target: Recommended size

trans-unit.source: Padding
trans-unit.target: Padding

trans-unit.source: 2 mm
trans-unit.target: 2 mm

trans-unit.source: Not applicable.
trans-unit.target: Not applicable.

trans-unit.source: Visual target size
trans-unit.target: Visual target size

trans-unit.source: 60% of actual size
trans-unit.target: 60% of actual size

trans-unit.source: 90-100% of actual size
trans-unit.target: 90-100% of actual size

trans-unit.source: Most users won't realize a visual target is touchable if it's less than 4.2 mm square (60% of the recommended minimum target size of 7 mm).
trans-unit.target: Most users won't realize a visual target is touchable if it's less than 4.2 mm square (60% of the recommended minimum target size of 7 mm).

trans-unit.source: Actual target size
trans-unit.target: Actual target size

trans-unit.source: 7 mm square
trans-unit.target: 7 mm square

trans-unit.source: Greater than or equal to 9 mm square (48 x 48 px @ 1x)
trans-unit.target: Greater than or equal to 9 mm square (48 x 48 px @ 1x)

trans-unit.source: Total target size
trans-unit.target: Total target size

trans-unit.source: 11 x 11 mm (approximately 60 px: three 20-px grid units @ 1x)
trans-unit.target: 11 x 11 mm (approximately 60 px: three 20-px grid units @ 1x)

trans-unit.source: This implies that the size of the actual target and padding combined should be larger than their respective minimums.
trans-unit.target: This implies that the size of the actual target and padding combined should be larger than their respective minimums.

trans-unit.source: These target size recommendations can be adjusted as required by your particular scenario.
trans-unit.target: These target size recommendations can be adjusted as required by your particular scenario.

trans-unit.source: Some of the considerations that went into these recommendations include:
trans-unit.target: Some of the considerations that went into these recommendations include:

trans-unit.source: Frequency of Touches: Consider making targets that are repeatedly or frequently pressed larger than the minimum size.
trans-unit.target: Frequency of Touches: Consider making targets that are repeatedly or frequently pressed larger than the minimum size.

trans-unit.source: Error Consequence: Targets that have severe consequences if touched in error should have greater padding and be placed further from the edge of the content area.
trans-unit.target: Error Consequence: Targets that have severe consequences if touched in error should have greater padding and be placed further from the edge of the content area.

trans-unit.source: This is especially true for targets that are touched frequently.
trans-unit.target: This is especially true for targets that are touched frequently.

trans-unit.target: Position in the content area

trans-unit.target: Form factor and screen size

trans-unit.source: Targeting assistance
trans-unit.target: Targeting assistance

trans-unit.source: Windows provides targeting assistance to support scenarios where the minimum size or padding recommendations presented here are not applicable; for example, hyperlinks on a webpage, calendar controls, drop down lists and combo boxes, or text selection.
trans-unit.target: Windows provides targeting assistance to support scenarios where the minimum size or padding recommendations presented here are not applicable; for example, hyperlinks on a webpage, calendar controls, drop down lists and combo boxes, or text selection.

trans-unit.source: These targeting platform improvements and user interface behaviors work together with visual feedback (disambiguation UI) to improve user accuracy and confidence.
trans-unit.target: These targeting platform improvements and user interface behaviors work together with visual feedback (disambiguation UI) to improve user accuracy and confidence.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Guidelines for visual feedback](guidelines-for-visualfeedback.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Guidelines for visual feedback](guidelines-for-visualfeedback.md).

trans-unit.source: If a touchable element must be smaller than the recommended minimum target size, the following techniques can be used to minimize the targeting issues that result.
trans-unit.target: If a touchable element must be smaller than the recommended minimum target size, the following techniques can be used to minimize the targeting issues that result.

trans-unit.source: Tethering
trans-unit.target: Tethering

trans-unit.source: Tethering is a visual cue (a connector from a contact point to the bounding rectangle of an object) used to indicate to a user that they are connected to, and interacting with, an object even though the input contact isn't directly in contact with the object.
trans-unit.target: Tethering is a visual cue (a connector from a contact point to the bounding rectangle of an object) used to indicate to a user that they are connected to, and interacting with, an object even though the input contact isn't directly in contact with the object.

trans-unit.source: This can occur when:
trans-unit.target: This can occur when:

trans-unit.source: A touch contact was first detected within some proximity threshold to an object and this object was identified as the most likely target of the contact.
trans-unit.target: A touch contact was first detected within some proximity threshold to an object and this object was identified as the most likely target of the contact.

trans-unit.source: A touch contact was moved off an object but the contact is still within a proximity threshold.
trans-unit.target: A touch contact was moved off an object but the contact is still within a proximity threshold.

trans-unit.source: This feature is not exposed to Windows Store app using JavaScript developers.
trans-unit.target: This feature is not exposed to Windows Store app using JavaScript developers.

trans-unit.source: Scrubbing
trans-unit.target: Scrubbing

trans-unit.source: Scrubbing means to touch anywhere within a field of targets and slide to select the desired target without lifting the finger until it is over the desired target.
trans-unit.target: Scrubbing means to touch anywhere within a field of targets and slide to select the desired target without lifting the finger until it is over the desired target.

trans-unit.source: This is also referred to as "take-off activation", where the object that is activated is the one that was last touched when the finger was lifted from the screen.
trans-unit.target: This is also referred to as "take-off activation", where the object that is activated is the one that was last touched when the finger was lifted from the screen.

trans-unit.source: Use the following guidelines when you design scrubbing interactions:
trans-unit.target: Use the following guidelines when you design scrubbing interactions:

trans-unit.source: Scrubbing is used in conjunction with disambiguation UI.
trans-unit.target: Scrubbing is used in conjunction with disambiguation UI.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Guidelines for visual feedback](guidelines-for-visualfeedback.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Guidelines for visual feedback](guidelines-for-visualfeedback.md).

trans-unit.source: The recommended minimum size for a scrubbing touch target is 20 px (3.75 mm @ 1x size).
trans-unit.target: The recommended minimum size for a scrubbing touch target is 20 px (3.75 mm @ 1x size).

trans-unit.source: Scrubbing takes precedence when performed on a pannable surface, such as a webpage.
trans-unit.target: Scrubbing takes precedence when performed on a pannable surface, such as a webpage.

trans-unit.source: Scrubbing targets should be close together.
trans-unit.target: Scrubbing targets should be close together.

trans-unit.source: An action is canceled when the user drags a finger off a scrubbing target.
trans-unit.target: An action is canceled when the user drags a finger off a scrubbing target.

trans-unit.source: Tethering to a scrubbing target is specified if the actions performed by the target are non-destructive, such as switching between dates on a calendar.
trans-unit.target: Tethering to a scrubbing target is specified if the actions performed by the target are non-destructive, such as switching between dates on a calendar.

trans-unit.source: Tethering is specified in a single direction, horizontally or vertically.
trans-unit.target: Tethering is specified in a single direction, horizontally or vertically.
